column4: When I try to delete an unused printer driver I get "403 Forbidden". Why
are you deleting it with sudo?
no. How/
just add sudo to the front of the command you are issuing and it will be removed.make sure the printer has no waiting jobs
I've been using the cups web page utility.  How do I determine what command to use from the command line/
gksudo firefox http://localhost:631
I still get 403 Forbidden
weird
is it not removable from the printer section i gnome settings
sudo system-config-printer does not give me a delete choice. Same with gnome settings. That is true for this one driver only. The others I can delete.
try a reboot with the printer not attached
I did. It didn't help. The driver is not for my printer. I don't know how it got installed.
it just appeared one day, and has been causing problem ever since.
it is not set as default printer, but is always the driver pre-selected.
can you remove the driver with apt-get ?
sorry. I don't what to type to do that.
have a searc in synaptic, see what relates to your printer
the driver is for the Epson 285.
ok then search for epson, if not then I am unsure
I did. I see nothing there.
how did you install the driver?
I didn't install it. It just appeared one day---very irritating.
I'd log a bug. If random printers are popping up then it sound like a bug to me
